body.name: My Grandmother’s Shadow: An utterly heartbreaking unputdownable historical novel based on a true story
body.description: One woman’s search for answers unfurls into a riveting multi-layered family saga, perfect for readers of Jean Grainger and Soraya Lane.Winter, 1941: Watching the smoke rise over the burning synagogue of the Riga Ghetto, Johanna Friedman’s only concern is keeping her family safe. As she prepares to leave her home, clutching what little possessions she is allowed to carry, her thoughts meander to a simpler time before the war – and a secret name, one she rarely recites out loud, forever embedded in her heart.Present day. Devorah was never allowed to ask about her mother’s repressed past, until her mother agreed to show her a hidden drawer containing her secret history. Devorah unravels the story of the amazing women who have shaped her legacy: the one who raised her mother as her own – and the one her mother never knew.Inspired by the true story of her maternal lineage, Devorah Shafrir Keret weaves a haunting, unforgettable saga of brave, broken women spanning a century of secrets and triumphs, unfaltering love and incredible loss, and the generation-spanning power of family.

reviews.reviewText: As well as historically correct. Just as real life stories are, it was impossible to predict what would be next. So good to hear the granddaughter of a Jewish woman who was both Jew and Catholic as she said it was a worthwhile task to find out what happened to her grandmother and that her mother seemed to find some peace, even in her dementia, in the thought that her mother did care.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A MUST READ FOR WOMEN!
reviews.reviewText: Since I was adopted, I completely understand one's need to find their roots, the chain of their ancestral history. This is a beautiful story about a family search that goes back prior to the holocaust in Germany and Israel. It is beautifully written, and can't be put down, once started. Take this beautiful journey. You won't regret one moment of it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is easily the best book I've read over the past 30 years. Without spoiling it for the readers of this review, let me just say the author is super-talented and expertly weaves the story of her mother's family during the Holocaust and her quest to uncover the hidden family secrets. This is a true story, backed by archived documents from Latvia and Germany. I couldn't put it down and read it all the way to the end. Amazing job by the author. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Delving into Past Mysteries to Discover Truth at Its Core
reviews.reviewText: My Grandmother's Shadow is an historical novel unlike any other I've read. The author writes from the vantage point of the present and methodically peels back layer after layer of family history against the backdrop of the Holocaust. As a young child, Devorah realized that she knew nothing about her mother's family, and every time she asked questions, she came up against a brick wall. Ultimately, as she grew into adulthood, she was able to discover a past that was unlike anything she could have imagined.My Grandmother's Shadow is fact-based fiction from Devorah's decades long search. This story is intensely compelling because the truths that are revealed take the reader beyond a story line and into the emotional landscape of three generations and shifting geography. Devorah is at the heart of the story because she persists in weaving together the details that seed her most authentic identity. The characters are human and relatable, the plot takes unexpected twists and turns, and the conclusion feels more like a new beginning than an ending. I heartily recommend this book for readers who savor the wonder of life stories and their legacies.

Great insights into European-Jewish fate....... Renate Price-Jahn, Germany. An authentic, fascinatingly written book , full of suspense starting in Riga. Lithania, then Leipzig, Germany, ending in Israel. From early childhood Devorah was puzzled by her mother's secret background. At seventeen she insisted to know her roots. Her mother pointed at a draw full of documents. Thus, together with Devorah, we learn about the horrific challenges her grandmother had gone through. Immensely exciting and informative, about suffering, love, reconciliation and human achievements.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Captivating book. I highly recommend reading!
reviews.reviewText: This book is hard to put down and very moving. I read it almost in one go. It is such a fascinating plot with an easy-to-read flow. It kept me curious, caught up, and thoroughly involved in this dramatic and sad story. The book is an incredible family saga, written from the point of view of the chain of three women of three generations of one family, inspired by the true historical story of the writer’s family over generations. It’s a lot about love, loss, and abonnement, about family secrets and layers of searching for truth and resolution.The book also provides an authentic glimpse into the complex and tragic life of Jewish people in Europe during World War 2, brought here so vividly to life, intertwining gently a wealth of accurate historical background. However, it is still an easy read as it gets the reader into the unique experiences, thoughts, and feelings of the three fascinating and complex women telling the story, and not put the historical tragedies and the holocaust as its focus.I truly recommend it. It is an excellent read if you enjoy historical fiction and family saga dramas.
